title: Juan Pablo Pereyra
text:
Juan Pablo Pereyra (born 30 May 1984 in <a href="San%20Lorenzo%2C%20Santa%20Fe">San Lorenzo</a>) is an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> midfielder or forward.
Career.
Pereyra made his playing debut in 2006 for <a href="El%20Linque%C3%B1o">El Linqueño</a> in the <a href="Torneo%20Argentino%20B">regionalised 4th division</a> of Argentine football. In 2006, he joined <a href="Primera%20B%20Nacional">2nd division</a> side <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tigre">Tigre</a> where he was part of the squad that won promotion to the <a href="Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Primera División</a> in 2007.
Between 2007 and 2008 he played for <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>an side <a href="Club%20Nacional%20de%20Football">Nacional</a> where he scored three goals in 18 league appearances.
In 2008, he returned to Argentine football, joining <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tucum%C3%A1n">Atlético Tucumán</a> of the 2nd division. He helped the team to win the <a href="2008-09%20in%20Argentine%20football">2008-09</a> championship and secure automatic promotion to the Primera División.
On July 17, 2010 Pereyra signed with <a href="Estudiantes%20de%20La%20Plata">Estudiantes de La Plata</a> for a reported transfer fee of close to $500,000.
In July 2011, he signed a one-year loan deal with <a href="Uni%C3%B3n%20de%20Santa%20Fe">Unión de Santa Fe</a> and on 16 August 2012, moved to his former club Atlético Tucumán on a free transfer.
